1.verse_text: The Proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:

To learn wisdom and moral instruction, and to discern wise counsel. in righteousness, justice, and equity. and a discerning plan to the young person. and let the discerning acquire guidance! ) the sayings of the wise and their riddles. but fools despise wisdom and instruction. and do not forsake the teaching from your mother. and like pendants around your neck. do not consent! We will lie in wait to shed blood; we will ambush an innocent person capriciously. those full of vigor like those going down to the Pit. we will fill our houses with plunder. We will all share equally in what we steal.' withhold yourself from their path; and they hasten to shed blood. in plain sight of any bird, they ambush their own lives! it takes away the life of those who obtain it! she shouts loudly in the plazas; in the entrances of the gates in the city she utters her words: How long will mockers delight in mockery and fools hate knowledge? then I will pour out my thoughts to you and I will make my words known to you. because I stretched out my hand but no one paid attention, and did not comply with my rebuke, I will mock when what you dread comes, and disaster strikes you like a devastating storm, when distressing trouble comes on you. they will diligently seek me, but they will not find me. and did not choose to fear the Lord, they spurned all my rebuke. and they will be stuffed full of their own counsel. simpletons will kill them, and the careless ease of fools will destroy them. and will be at ease from the dread of harm.
To receive moral instruction in skillful living,
To impart shrewdness to the morally naive,
(Let the wise also hear and gain instruction,
To discern the meaning of a proverb and a parable,
Fearing the Lord is the beginning of moral knowledge,
Listen, my child, to the instruction from your father,
For they will be like an elegant garland on your head,
My child, if sinners try to entice you,
If they say, 'Come with us!
We will swallow them alive like Sheol,
We will seize all kinds of precious wealth;
Join with us!
My child, do not go down their way,
for they are eager to inflict harm,
Surely it is futile to spread a net
but these men lie in wait for their own blood,
Such are the ways of all who gain profit unjustly;
Wisdom calls out in the street,
at the head of the noisy streets she calls,
'How long will you simpletons love naivetÃ©?
If only you will respond to my rebuke,
However, because I called but you refused to listen,
because you neglected all my advice,
so I myself will laugh when disaster strikes you,
when what you dread comes like a whirlwind,
Then they will call to me, but I will not answer;
Because they hated moral knowledge,
they did not comply with my advice,
Therefore they will eat from the fruit of their way,
For the waywardness of the
But the one who listens to me will live in security,

2.verse_text: My child, if you receive my words, and store up my commands within you, and by turning your heart to understanding, raise your voice for understanding – and search for it like hidden treasure, and you will discover knowledge about God. and from his mouth comes knowledge and understanding. and is like a shield for those who live with integrity, and to protect the way of his pious ones. and equity – every good way. and moral knowledge will be attractive to you. from those speaking perversity, to walk on the dark ways, they rejoice in perverse evil; and who are devious in their ways; from the sexually loose woman who speaks flattering words; and forgets her marriage covenant made before God. and her paths lead to the place of the departed spirits. nor will they reach the paths of life. and will keep on the paths of the righteous. and those with integrity will remain in it, and the treacherous will be torn away from it.
by making your ear attentive to wisdom,
indeed, if you call out for discernment –
if you seek it like silver,
then you will understand how to fear the Lord,
For the Lord gives wisdom,
He stores up effective counsel for the upright,
to guard the paths of the righteous
Then you will understand righteousness and justice
For wisdom will enter your heart,
Discretion will protect you, understanding will guard you,
to deliver you from the way of the wicked,
who leave the upright paths
who delight in doing evil,
whose paths are morally crooked,
to deliver you from the adulteress,
who leaves the husband from her younger days,
For her house sinks down to death,
None who go in to her will return,
So you will walk in the way of good people,
For the upright will reside in the land,
but the wicked will be removed from the land,

3.verse_text: My child, do not forget my teaching, but let your heart keep my commandments, and they will add well-being to you. write them on the tablet of your heart. in the sight of God and people. and do not rely on your own understanding. and he will make your paths straight. fear the Lord and turn away from evil. and refreshment to your inner self. and from the first fruits of all your crops; and your vats will overflow with new wine. and do not loathe his rebuke. just as a father disciplines the son in whom he delights. and the one who obtains understanding. and her gain is better than gold. and none of the things you desire can compare with her. and everyone who grasps hold of her will be blessed. he established the heavens by understanding. and the clouds drip down dew. safeguard sound wisdom and discretion. and grace to adorn your neck. and you will not stumble. when you lie down your sleep will be pleasant. or when destruction overtakes the wicked; and he will guard your foot from being caught in a trap. when you have the ability to help. and I will give it,' when you have it with you at the time. when he dwells by you unsuspectingly. and do not choose to imitate any of his ways; but he reveals his intimate counsel to the upright. but he blesses the home of the righteous. yet he shows favor to the humble. but he holds fools up to public contempt.
for they will provide a long and full life,
Do not let truth and mercy leave you; bind them around your neck, in her left hand are riches and honor. and all her paths are peaceful. if he has not treated you wrongly.
Then you will find favor and good understanding,
Trust in the Lord with all your heart,
Acknowledge him in all your ways,
Do not be wise in your own estimation;
This will bring healing to your body,
Honor the Lord from your wealth
then your barns will be filled completely,
My child, do not despise discipline from the Lord,
For the Lord disciplines those he loves,
Blessed is the one who finds wisdom,
For her benefit is more profitable than silver,
She is more precious than rubies,
Long life is in her right hand;
Her ways are very pleasant,
She is like a tree of life to those who obtain her,
By wisdom the Lord laid the foundation of the earth;
By his knowledge the primordial sea was broken open,
My child, do not let them escape from your sight;
So they will give life to you,
Then you will walk on your way with security,
When you lie down you will not be filled with fear;
You will not be afraid of sudden disaster,
for the Lord will be the source of your confidence,
Do not withhold good from those who need it,
Do not say to your neighbor, 'Go! Return tomorrow
Do not plot evil against your neighbor
Do not accuse anyone without legitimate cause,
Do not envy a violent man,
for one who goes astray is an abomination to the Lord,
The Lord "s curse is on the household of the wicked,
Although he is scornful to arrogant scoffers,
The wise inherit honor,

4.verse_text: Listen, children, to a father"s instruction, and pay attention so that you may gain discernment. a tender only child before my mother, keep my commands so that you will live. do not forget and do not turn aside from the words I speak. and whatever you acquire, acquire understanding! she will bestow a beautiful crown on you.' so that the years of your life will be many. and I will lead you in upright paths. and when you run, you will not stumble. protect it, because it is your life. or walk in the way of those who are evil. turn away from it, and go on. they are robbed of sleep until they make someone stumble. and drink wine obtained from violence. growing brighter and brighter until full day. they do not know what causes them to stumble. listen attentively to my sayings. guard them within your heart; and healing to one"s entire body. for from it are the sources of life. keep devious talk far from your lips. and let your gaze look straight before you. so that all your ways may be established. turn yourself away from evil.
Because I give you good instruction, do not forsake my teaching. 'Let your heart lay hold of my words; love her, and she will guard you. she will honor you if you embrace her.
When I was a son to my father,
he taught me, and he said to me:
Acquire wisdom, acquire understanding;
Do not forsake wisdom, and she will protect you;
Wisdom is supreme – so acquire wisdom,
Esteem her highly and she will exalt you;
She will place a fair garland on your head;
Listen, my child, and accept my words,
I will guide you in the way of wisdom
When you walk, your steps will not be hampered,
Hold on to instruction, do not let it go;
Do not enter the path of the wicked
Avoid it, do not go on it;
For they cannot sleep unless they cause harm;
For they eat bread gained from wickedness
But the path of the righteous is like the bright morning light,
The way of the wicked is like gloomy darkness;
My child, pay attention to my words;
Do not let them depart from your sight,
for they are life to those who find them
Guard your heart with all vigilance,
Remove perverse speech from your mouth;
Let your eyes look directly in front of you
Make the path for your feet level,
Do not turn to the right or to the left;

5.verse_text: My child, be attentive to my wisdom, pay close attention to my understanding, and her seductive words are smoother than olive oil, sharp as a two-edged sword. her steps lead straight to the grave. her paths are unstable but she does not know it. do not turn aside from the words I speak. and your labor benefit another man"s house. when your flesh and your body are wasted away. and I did not heed my instructors. in the midst of the whole congregation!' and running water from your own well. and not for strangers with you. and may you rejoice in your young wife – may you be captivated by her love always. and embrace the bosom of a different woman? and the Lord weighs all that person"s paths. and he will be held by the cords of his own sin. because of the greatness of his folly he will reel.

in order to safeguard discretion, and that your lips may guard knowledge. and do not go near the door of her house, and your years to a cruel person, My heart spurned reproof! your streams of water in the wide plazas? may her breasts satisfy you at all times,
For the lips of the adulterous woman drip honey,
but in the end she is bitter as wormwood,
Her feet go down to death;
Lest she should make level the path leading to life,
So now, children, listen to me;
Keep yourself far from her,
lest you give your vigor to others
lest strangers devour your strength,
And at the end of your life you will groan
And you will say, 'How I hated discipline!
For I did not obey my teachers
I almost came to complete ruin
Drink water from your own cistern
Should your springs be dispersed outside,
Let them be for yourself alone,
May your fountain be blessed,
a loving doe, a graceful deer;
But why should you be captivated, my son, by an adulteress,
For the ways of a person are in front of the Lord "s eyes,
The wicked will be captured by his own iniquities,
He will die because there was no discipline;

6.verse_text: My child, if you have made a pledge for your neighbor, and have become a guarantor for a stranger, because you have fallen into your neighbor"s power: go, humble yourself, and appeal firmly to your neighbor. and like a bird from the trap of the fowler. overseer, or ruler, it gathers at the harvest what it will eat. When will you rise from your sleep? a little folding of the hands to relax, and your need like an armed man. walks around saying perverse things; and points with his fingers; he spreads contention at all times. in an instant he will be broken, and there will be no remedy. even seven things that are an abomination to him: and hands that shed innocent blood, feet that are swift to run to evil, and a person who spreads discord among family members. when you wake up, they will talk to you. and rebukes of discipline are like the road leading to life, from the smooth tongue of the loose woman. and do not let her captivate you with her alluring eyes; but the wife of another man preys on your precious life. without burning his clothes? no one who touches her will escape punishment. to fulfill his need when he is hungry. he might even have to give all the wealth of his house. whoever does it destroys his own life. and his reproach will not be wiped away; and he will not show mercy when he takes revenge. he will not be willing, even if you multiply the compensation.

if you have been ensnared by the words you have uttered, and have been caught by the words you have spoken, or slumber to your eyelids. observe its ways and be wise! signals with his feet, and do not forsake the instruction of your mother. fasten them around your neck. when you lie down, they will watch over you; instruction is like a light, without scorching his feet?
then, my child, do this in order to deliver yourself,
Permit no sleep to your eyes
Deliver yourself like a gazelle from a snare,
Go to the ant, you sluggard;
It has no commander,
yet it prepares its food in the summer;
How long, you sluggard, will you lie there?
A little sleep, a little slumber,
and your poverty will come like a robber,
A worthless and wicked person
he winks with his eyes,
he plots evil with perverse thoughts in his heart,
Therefore, his disaster will come suddenly;
There are six things that the Lord hates,
haughty eyes, a lying tongue,
a heart that devises wicked plans,
a false witness who pours out lies,
My child, guard the commands of your father
Bind them on your heart continually;
When you walk about, they will guide you;
For the commandments are like a lamp,
by keeping you from the evil woman,
Do not lust in your heart for her beauty,
for on account of a prostitute one is brought down to a loaf of bread,
Can a man hold fire against his chest
Can a man walk on hot coals
So it is with the one who has sex with his neighbor"s wife;
People do not despise a thief when he steals
Yet if he is caught he must repay seven times over,
A man who commits adultery with a woman lacks wisdom,
He will be beaten and despised,
for jealousy kindles a husband"s rage,
He will not consider any compensation;

7.verse_text: My child, keep my words and treasure up my commands in your own keeping. and obey my instruction as your most prized possession. write them on the tablet of your heart. from the loose woman who flatters you with her words. I discerned among the youths – a young man who lacked wisdom. making his way along the road to her house in the dark of the night. She was dressed like a prostitute and with secret intent. she does not remain at home – and with a bold expression she said to him, to look for you, and I found you! with richly colored fabric from Egypt. let"s delight ourselves with sexual intercourse. he will not return until the end of the month.' with her smooth talk she compelled him. like a stag prancing into a trapper"s snare and he does not know that it will cost him his life. and pay attention to the words I speak. and all those she has slain are many. going down to the chambers of death.
Keep my commands so that you may live,
Bind them on your forearm;

Say to wisdom, 'You are my sister,' and call understanding a close relative, through my window lattice I looked out and by every corner she lies in wait.) today I have fulfilled my vows! with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon. he has gone on a journey of some distance. like an ox that goes to the slaughter, like a bird hurrying into a trap, do not wander into her pathways;
so that they may keep you from the adulterous woman,
For at the window of my house
and I saw among the naive –
He was passing by the street near her corner,
in the twilight, the evening,
Suddenly a woman came out to meet him!
(She is loud and rebellious,
at one time outside, at another in the wide plazas,
So she grabbed him and kissed him,
'I have fresh meat at home;
That is why I came out to meet you,
I have spread my bed with elegant coverings,
I have perfumed my bed
Come, let"s drink deeply of lovemaking until morning,
For my husband is not at home;
He has taken a bag of money with him;
She persuaded him with persuasive words;
Suddenly he went after her
till an arrow pierces his liver –
So now, sons, listen to me,
Do not let your heart turn aside to her ways –
for she has brought down many fatally wounded,
Her house is the way to the grave,

8.verse_text: Does not wisdom call out? Does not understanding raise her voice? and upright to those who find knowledge. and knowledge rather than choice gold. I possess understanding and might. and those who seek me find me. long-lasting wealth and righteousness. in the pathway of justice, before his deeds of long ago. before the hills – I was born, when he marked out the foundations of the earth, rejoicing before him at all times, blessed are those who keep my ways. and do not neglect it.

At the top of the elevated places along the way, at the intersection of the paths she takes her stand; at the entrance of the doorways she cries out: and my voice calls to all mankind. And you fools, understand discernment! and my lips will utter what is right. and my lips hate wickedness. there is nothing in them twisted or crooked. and desirable things cannot be compared to her. and I find knowledge and discretion. I hate arrogant pride and the evil way and perverse utterances. and potentates decree righteousness; as well as nobles and all righteous judges. and what I produce is better than choice silver. and that I may fill their treasuries. from the beginning, from before the world existed. when there were no springs overflowing with water; or the beginning of the dust of the world. when he marked out the horizon over the face of the deep, when the fountains of the deep grew strong, that the waters should not pass over his command, and I was his delight day by day, and delighting in its people. watching at my doors day by day, waiting beside my doorway. and receives favor from the Lord . all who hate me love death.'
beside the gates opening into the city,
'To you, O people, I call out,
You who are naive, discern wisdom!
Listen, for I will speak excellent things,
For my mouth speaks truth,
All the words of my mouth are righteous;
All of them are clear to the discerning
Receive my instruction rather than silver,
For wisdom is better than rubies,
'I, wisdom, live with prudence,
The fear of the Lord is to hate evil;
Counsel and sound wisdom belong to me;
Kings reign by means of me,
by me princes rule,
I love those who love me,
Riches and honor are with me,
My fruit is better than the purest gold,
I walk in the path of righteousness,
that I may cause those who love me to inherit wealth,
The Lord created me as the beginning of his works,
From eternity I was appointed,
When there were no deep oceans I was born,
before the mountains were set in place –
before he made the earth and its fields,
When he established the heavens, I was there;
when he established the clouds above,
when he gave the sea his decree
then I was beside him as a master craftsman,
rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth,
'So now, children, listen to me;
Listen to my instruction so that you may be wise,
Blessed is the one who listens to me,
For the one who finds me finds life
But the one who does not find me brings harm to himself;

9.verse_text: Wisdom has built her house; she has carved out its seven pillars. she also has arranged her table. she calls out on the highest places of the city. she says to those who lack understanding. and drink some of the wine I have mixed. and proceed in the way of understanding.' whoever reproves a wicked person receives abuse. teach a righteous person and he will add to his learning. and acknowledging the Holy One is understanding. and years will be added to your life. but if you are a mocker, you alone must bear it. she is naive and does not know anything. who go straight on their way. she says to those who lack understanding. and food obtained in secret is pleasant!' that her guests are in the depths of the grave.
She has prepared her meat, she has mixed her wine;
She has sent out her female servants;
'Whoever is naive, let him turn in here,'
Abandon your foolish ways so that you may live,
Whoever corrects a mocker is asking for insult;
Do not reprove a mocker or he will hate you; reprove a wise person and he will love you. on a seat at the highest point of the city,
Give instruction to a wise person, and he will become wiser still;
The beginning of wisdom is to fear the Lord ,
For because of me your days will be many,
If you are wise, you are wise to your own advantage,
The woman called Folly is brash,
So she sits at the door of her house,
calling out to those who are passing by her in the way,
'Whoever is simple, let him turn in here,'
But they do not realize that the dead are there,

10.verse_text: The Proverbs of Solomon: A wise child makes a father rejoice, but a foolish child is a grief to his mother. but righteousness delivers from mortal danger. but he thwarts the craving of the wicked. but the one who works diligently becomes wealthy. but the one who sleeps during the harvest is a son who brings shame to himself. but the speech of the wicked conceals violence. but the reputation of the wicked will rot. but the one who speaks foolishness will come to ruin. but the one who behaves perversely will be found out. and the one who speaks foolishness will come to ruin. but the speech of the wicked conceals violence. but love covers all transgressions. but the one who lacks wisdom will be disciplined. but foolish speech leads to imminent destruction. but the poor are brought to ruin by their poverty. the recompense which the wicked receive is judgment. but the one who rejects rebuke goes astray. and the one who spreads slander is certainly a fool. but the one who restrains his words is wise. but what the wicked think is of little value. but fools die for lack of wisdom. and he adds no sorrow to it. and so is wisdom for the one who has discernment. what the righteous desire will be granted. but the righteous are an everlasting foundation. so is the sluggard to those who send him. but the life span of the wicked will be shortened. but the expectation of the wicked will remain unfulfilled. but it is destruction to evildoers. but the wicked will not inhabit the land. but the one who speaks perversion will be destroyed. but the speech of the wicked is perverse.
Treasures gained by wickedness do not profit,
The Lord satisfies the appetite of the righteous,
The one who is lazy becomes poor,
The one who gathers crops in the summer is a wise son,
Blessings are on the head of the righteous,
The memory of the righteous is a blessing,
The wise person accepts instructions,
The one who conducts himself in integrity will live securely,
The one who winks his eye causes trouble,
The teaching of the righteous is a fountain of life,
Hatred stirs up dissension,
Wisdom is found in the words of the discerning person,
Those who are wise store up knowledge,
The wealth of a rich person is like a fortified city,
The reward which the righteous receive is life;
The one who heeds instruction is on the way to life,
The one who conceals hatred utters lies,
When words abound, transgression is inevitable,
What the righteous say is like the best silver,
The teaching of the righteous feeds many,
The blessing from the Lord makes a person rich,
Carrying out a wicked scheme is enjoyable to a fool,
What the wicked fears will come on him;
When the storm passes through, the wicked are swept away,
Like vinegar to the teeth and like smoke to the eyes,
Fearing the Lord prolongs life,
The hope of the righteous is joy,
The way of the Lord is like a stronghold for the upright,
The righteous will never be moved,
The speech of the righteous bears the fruit of wisdom,
The lips of the righteous know what is pleasing,

11.verse_text: The Lord abhors dishonest scales, but an accurate weight is his delight. but with humility comes wisdom. but the crookedness of the unfaithful destroys them. but righteousness delivers from mortal danger. but the wicked person will fall by his own wickedness. but the faithless will be captured by their own desires. and the hope of his strength perishes. and the wicked turns up in his stead. but by knowledge the righteous will be delivered. but it is destroyed by the counsel of the wicked. but the one who has discernment keeps silent. but the one who is trustworthy conceals a matter. but there is success in the abundance of counselors. but whoever avoids shaking hands will be secure. and ruthless men seize wealth. but a cruel person brings himself trouble. but the one who sows righteousness reaps a genuine reward. but the one who pursues evil pursues it to his own death. but those who are blameless in their ways are his delight. but the descendants of the righteous will not suffer unjust judgment. is a beautiful woman who rejects discretion. but what the wicked hope for leads to wrath. but another withholds more than he should and comes to poverty. and the one who provides water for others will himself be satisfied. but they will praise the one who sells it. but the one who searches for evil – it will come to him. but the righteous will flourish like a green leaf. and the fool will be a servant to the wise person. and the one who wins souls is wise. how much more the wicked sinner!
When pride comes, then comes disgrace,
The integrity of the upright guides them,
Wealth does not profit in the day of wrath,
The righteousness of the blameless will make straight their way,
The righteousness of the upright will deliver them,
When a wicked person dies, his expectation perishes,
The righteous person is delivered out of trouble,
With his speech the godless person destroys his neighbor,
When the righteous do well, the city rejoices; when the wicked perish, there is joy.
A city is exalted by the blessing provided from the upright,
The one who denounces his neighbor lacks wisdom,
The one who goes about slandering others reveals secrets,
When there is no guidance a nation falls,
The one who puts up security for a stranger will surely have trouble,
A generous woman gains honor,
A kind person benefits himself,
The wicked person earns deceitful wages,
True righteousness leads to life,
The Lord abhors those who are perverse in heart,
Be assured that the evil person will certainly be punished,
Like a gold ring in a pig"s snout
What the righteous desire leads only to good,
One person is generous and yet grows more wealthy,
A generous person will be enriched,
People will curse the one who withholds grain,
The one who diligently seeks good seeks favor,
The one who trusts in his riches will fall,
The one who troubles his family will inherit nothing,
The fruit of the righteous is like a tree producing life,
If the righteous are recompensed on earth,

12.verse_text: The one who loves discipline loves knowledge, but the one who hates reproof is stupid. but the Lord condemns a person with wicked schemes. but a righteous root cannot be moved. but the wife who acts shamefully is like rottenness in his bones. the counsels of the wicked are deceitful. but the words of the upright will deliver them. but the righteous household will stand. but the one who has a twisted mind is despised. than one who pretends to be somebody important yet has no food. but even the most compassionate acts of the wicked are cruel. but whoever chases daydreams lacks wisdom. but the righteous root endures. but the righteous person escapes out of trouble. and the work of his hands will be rendered to him. but the one who listens to advice is wise. but the prudent overlooks an insult. but a false witness speaks deceit. but the words of the wise bring healing. but the one who lies will last only for a moment. but those who promote peace have joy. but the wicked are filled with calamity. but those who deal truthfully are his delight. but foolish people publicize folly. but the slothful will become a slave. but an encouraging word brings him joy. but personal possessions are precious to the diligent. but another path leads to death.
A good person obtains favor from the Lord ,
No one can be established through wickedness,
A noble wife is the crown of her husband,
The plans of the righteous are just;
The words of the wicked lie in wait to shed innocent blood,
The wicked are overthrown and perish,
A person is praised in accordance with his wisdom,
Better is a person of humble standing who nevertheless has a servant,
A righteous person cares for the life of his animal,
The one who works his field will have plenty of food,
The wicked person desires a stronghold,
The evil person is ensnared by the transgression of his speech,
A person will be satisfied with good from the fruit of his words,
The way of a fool is right in his own opinion,
A fool"s annoyance is known at once,
The faithful witness tells what is right,
Speaking recklessly is like the thrusts of a sword,
The one who tells the truth will endure forever,
Deceit is in the heart of those who plot evil,
The righteous do not encounter any harm,
The Lord abhors a person who lies,
The shrewd person conceals knowledge,
The diligent person will rule,
Anxiety in a person"s heart weighs him down,
The righteous person is cautious in his friendship, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
The lazy person does not roast his prey,
In the path of righteousness there is life,

13.verse_text: A wise son accepts his father"s discipline, but a scoffer does not listen to rebuke. but the faithless desire the fruit of violence. but whoever is talkative will come to ruin. but the desire of the diligent will be abundantly satisfied. but the wicked person acts in shameful disgrace. but wickedness overthrows the sinner. another pretends to be poor and yet possesses great wealth. but the poor person hears no threat. but the lamp of the wicked goes out. but wisdom is with the well-advised. but the one who gathers it little by little will become rich. but a longing fulfilled is like a tree of life. but whoever esteems instruction will be rewarded. to turn a person from deadly snares. but the conduct of the unfaithful is harsh. but a fool displays his folly. but a faithful envoy brings healing. but the one who accepts reproof is honored. but fools abhor turning away from evil. but a companion of fools suffers harm. but prosperity rewards the righteous. but the wealth of a sinner is stored up for the righteous. but it is swept away by injustice. but the one who loves his child is diligent in disciplining him. but the belly of the wicked lacks food.
From the fruit of his speech a person eats good things,
The one who guards his words guards his life,
The appetite of the sluggard craves but gets nothing,
The righteous person hates anything false,
Righteousness guards the one who lives with integrity,
There is one who pretends to be rich and yet has nothing;
The ransom of a person"s life is his wealth,
The light of the righteous shines brightly,
With pride comes only contention,
Wealth gained quickly will dwindle away,
Hope deferred makes the heart sick,
The one who despises instruction will pay the penalty,
Instruction from the wise is like a life-giving fountain,
Keen insight wins favor,
Every shrewd person acts with knowledge,
An unreliable messenger falls into trouble,
The one who neglects discipline ends up in poverty and shame,
A desire fulfilled is sweet to the soul,
The one who associates with the wise grows wise,
Calamity pursues sinners,
A benevolent person leaves an inheritance for his grandchildren,
There is abundant food in the field of the poor,
The one who spares his rod hates his child,
The righteous has enough food to satisfy his appetite,

14.verse_text: Every wise woman builds her household, but a foolish woman tears it down with her own hands. but those who love the rich are many. but whoever is kind to the needy is blessed.

The one who walks in his uprightness fears the Lord , but the one who is perverted in his ways despises him. but the words of the wise protect them. but an abundant harvest is produced by strong oxen. but a false witness breathes out lies. but understanding is easy for a discerning person. or you will not understand wise counsel. but the folly of fools is deception. but among the upright there is favor. and with its joy no one else can share. but the tent of the upright will flourish. but its end is the way that leads to death. and the end of joy may be grief. but a good person will be rewarded for his. but the shrewd person discerns his steps. but a fool throws off restraint and is overconfident. and a person with crafty schemes is hated. but the shrewd are crowned with knowledge. and the wicked will bow at the gates of the righteous. But those who plan good exhibit faithful covenant love. but merely talking about it only brings poverty. but the folly of fools is folly. but the one who breathes lies brings deception. and it will be a refuge for his children. to turn people from deadly snares. but the lack of subjects is the ruin of a ruler. but the one who has a quick temper exalts folly. but envy is rottenness to the bones. but whoever shows favor to the needy honors him. but the righteous have refuge even in the threat of death. it is known even in the heart of fools. but sin is a disgrace to any people. but his wrath falls on one who acts shamefully.
In the speech of a fool is a rod for his back,
Where there are no oxen, the feeding trough is clean,
A truthful witness does not lie,
The scorner seeks wisdom but finds none,
Leave the presence of a foolish person,
The wisdom of the shrewd person is to discern his way,
Fools mock at reparation,
The heart knows its own bitterness,
The household of the wicked will be destroyed,
There is a way that seems right to a person,
Even in laughter the heart may ache,
The backslider will be paid back from his own ways,
A naive person believes everything,
A wise person is cautious and turns from evil,
A person who has a quick temper does foolish things,
The naive inherit folly,
Those who are evil will bow before those who are good,
A poor person is disliked even by his neighbors,
The one who despises his neighbor sins,
Do not those who devise evil go astray?
In all hard work there is profit,
The crown of the wise is their riches,
A truthful witness rescues lives,
In the fear of the Lord one has strong confidence,
The fear of the Lord is like a life-giving fountain,
A king"s glory is the abundance of people,
The one who is slow to anger has great understanding,
A tranquil spirit revives the body,
The one who oppresses the poor insults his Creator,
The wicked will be thrown down in his trouble,
Wisdom rests in the heart of the discerning;
Righteousness exalts a nation,
The king shows favor to a wise servant,

15.verse_text: A gentle response turns away anger, but a harsh word stirs up wrath. but the mouth of the fool spouts out folly. keeping watch on those who are evil and those who are good. but a perverse tongue breaks the spirit. but whoever heeds reproof shows good sense. but the income of the wicked brings trouble. but not so the heart of fools. but the prayer of the upright pleases him. but he loves those who pursue righteousness. the one who hates reproof will die. how much more the hearts of humans! he will not go to the wise. but the mouth of fools feeds on folly. but one with a cheerful heart has a continual feast. than great wealth and turmoil with it. than a fattened ox where there is hatred. but one who is slow to anger calms a quarrel. but the path of the upright is like a highway. but a foolish person despises his mother. but one who has understanding follows an upright course. but with abundant advisers they are established. and a word at the right time – how good it is! to keep him from going downward to Sheol. but he maintains the boundaries of the widow. but pleasant words are pure. but whoever hates bribes will live. but the mouth of the wicked pours out evil things. but he hears the prayer of the righteous. and good news gives health to the body. is at home among the wise. but whoever hears reproof acquires understanding. and before honor comes humility.
The tongue of the wise treats knowledge correctly,
The eyes of the Lord are in every place,
Speech that heals is like a life-giving tree,
A fool rejects his father"s discipline,
In the house of the righteous is abundant wealth,
The lips of the wise spread knowledge,
The Lord abhors the sacrifices of the wicked,
The Lord abhors the way of the wicked,
Severe discipline is for the one who abandons the way;
Death and Destruction are before the Lord –
The scorner does not love one who corrects him;
A joyful heart makes the face cheerful, but by a painful heart the spirit is broken.
The discerning heart seeks knowledge,
All the days of the afflicted are bad,
Better is little with the fear of the Lord
Better a meal of vegetables where there is love
A quick-tempered person stirs up dissension,
The way of the sluggard is like a hedge of thorns,
A wise child brings joy to his father,
Folly is a joy to one who lacks sense,
Plans fail when there is no counsel,
A person has joy in giving an appropriate answer,
The path of life is upward for the wise person,
The Lord tears down the house of the proud,
The Lord abhors the plans of the wicked,
The one who is greedy for gain troubles his household,
The heart of the righteous considers how to answer,
The Lord is far from the wicked,
A bright look brings joy to the heart,
The person who hears the reproof that leads to life
The one who refuses correction despises himself,
The fear of the Lord provides wise instruction,

16.verse_text: The intentions of the heart belong to a man, but the answer of the tongue comes from the Lord . but the Lord evaluates the motives. and your plans will be established. even the wicked for the day of disaster. rest assured that they will not go unpunished. through fearing the Lord one avoids evil. he even reconciles his enemies to himself. than to have abundant income without justice. but the Lord directs his steps. his pronouncements must not act treacherously against justice. all the weights in the bag are his handiwork. because a throne is established in righteousness. and they love the one who speaks uprightly. but a wise person appeases it. and his favor is like the clouds of the spring rain. to acquire understanding is more desirable than silver. the one who guards his way safeguards his life. and a haughty spirit before a fall. than to share the spoils with the proud. and blessed is the one who trusts in the Lord . and kind speech increases persuasiveness. but folly leads to the discipline of fools. and it adds persuasiveness to his words. sweet to the soul and healing to the bones. but its end is the way that leads to death. for his hunger urges him to work. and his slander is like a scorching fire. and a gossip separates the closest friends. and leads him down a path that is terrible. and one who compresses his lips brings about evil. it is attained in the path of righteousness. and one who controls his temper is better than one who captures a city. but their every decision is from the Lord .
All a person"s ways seem right in his own opinion,
Commit your works to the Lord ,
The Lord works everything for its own ends –
The Lord abhors every arrogant person;
Through loyal love and truth iniquity is appeased;
When a person"s ways are pleasing to the Lord ,
Better to have a little with righteousness
A person plans his course,
The divine verdict is in the words of the king,
Honest scales and balances are from the Lord ;
Doing wickedness is an abomination to kings,
The delight of kings is righteous counsel,
A king"s wrath is like a messenger of death,
In the light of the king"s face there is life,
How much better it is to acquire wisdom than gold;
The highway of the upright is to turn away from evil;
Pride goes before destruction,
It is better to be lowly in spirit with the afflicted
The one who deals wisely in a matter will find success,
The one who is wise in heart is called discerning,
Insight is like a life-giving fountain to the one who possesses it,
A wise person"s heart makes his speech wise
Pleasant words are like a honeycomb,
There is a way that seems right to a person,
A laborer"s appetite works on his behalf,
A wicked scoundrel digs up evil,
A perverse person spreads dissension,
A violent person entices his neighbor,
The one who winks his eyes devises perverse things,
Gray hair is like a crown of glory;
Better to be slow to anger than to be a mighty warrior,
The dice are thrown into the lap,

17.verse_text: Better is a dry crust of bread where there is quietness than a house full of feasting with strife. over an heir who behaves shamefully, and will share the inheritance along with the relatives. likewise the Lord tests hearts. a liar listens to a malicious tongue. and the glory of children is their parents. how much less are lies for a ruler! in whatever he does he succeeds. but whoever repeats a matter separates close friends. than a hundred blows on a fool. and so a cruel messenger will be sent against him. than to encounter a fool in his folly. evil will not leave his house. stop it before strife breaks out! both of them are an abomination to the Lord . since he has no intention of acquiring wisdom? and a relative is born to help in adversity. and puts up financial security for his neighbor. whoever builds his gate high seeks destruction. and the one who is deceitful in speech falls into trouble. and the father of a fool has no joy. but a crushed spirit dries up the bones. to pervert the ways of justice. but the eyes of a fool run to the ends of the earth. and bitterness to the mother who bore him. and to flog honorable men is wrong. and the one who stays calm is discerning. and the one who holds his tongue is deemed discerning.
A servant who acts wisely will rule
The crucible is for refining silver and the furnace is for gold,
One who acts wickedly pays attention to evil counsel;
The one who mocks the poor insults his Creator; whoever rejoices over disaster will not go unpunished.
Grandchildren are like a crown to the elderly,
Excessive speech is not becoming for a fool;
A bribe works like a charm for the one who offers it;
The one who forgives an offense seeks love,
A rebuke makes a greater impression on a discerning person
An evil person seeks only rebellion,
It is better for a person to meet a mother bear being robbed of her cubs,
As for the one who repays evil for good,
Starting a quarrel is like letting out water;
The one who acquits the guilty and the one who condemns the innocent –
Of what use is money in the hand of a fool,
A friend loves at all times,
The one who lacks wisdom strikes hands in pledge,
The one who loves a quarrel loves transgression;
The one who has a perverse heart does not find good,
Whoever brings a fool into the world does so to his grief,
A cheerful heart brings good healing,
A wicked person receives a bribe secretly
Wisdom is directly in front of the discerning person,
A foolish child is a grief to his father,
It is terrible to punish a righteous person,
The truly wise person restrains his words,
Even a fool who remains silent is considered wise,

18.verse_text: One who has isolated himself seeks his own desires; he rejects all sound judgment. but only in disclosing what is on his mind. and with shame comes a reproach. and the fountain of wisdom is like a flowing brook. by depriving a righteous man of justice. and his mouth invites a flogging. and his lips are a snare for his life. they go down into the person"s innermost being. is a brother to one who destroys. the righteous person runs to it and is set safely on high. and it is like a high wall in his imagination. but humility comes before honor. that is his folly and his shame. but who can bear a crushed spirit? and the wise person seeks knowledge. and leads him before important people. until his opponent begins to cross-examine him. and settles the issue between strong opponents. and disputes are like the barred gates of a fortified citadel. and those who love its use will eat its fruit. and receives a pleasurable gift from the Lord . but a rich man answers harshly.
A fool takes no pleasure in understanding
When a wicked person arrives, contempt shows up with him,
The words of a person"s mouth are like deep waters,
It is terrible to show partiality to the wicked,
The lips of a fool enter into strife,
The mouth of a fool is his ruin,
The words of a gossip are like choice morsels;
The one who is slack in his work
The name of the Lord is like a strong tower;
The wealth of a rich person is like a strong city,
Before destruction the heart of a person is proud,
The one who gives an answer before he listens –
A person"s spirit sustains him through sickness –
The discerning person acquires knowledge,
A person"s gift makes room for him,
The first to state his case seems right,
A toss of a coin ends disputes,
A relative offended is harder to reach than a strong city,
From the fruit of a person"s mouth his stomach is satisfied, with the product of his lips is he satisfied. but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
The one who finds a wife finds what is enjoyable,
A poor person makes supplications,
A person who has friends may be harmed by them,

19.verse_text: Better is a poor person who walks in his integrity than one who is perverse in his speech and is a fool. and the one who acts hastily makes poor choices. and his heart rages against the Lord . but a poor person is separated from his friend. and the one who spouts out lies will not escape punishment. and everyone is the friend of the person who gives gifts. he pursues them with words, but they do not respond. the one who preserves understanding will prosper. and the one who spouts out lies will perish. how much less for a servant to rule over princes! and it is his glory to overlook an offense. but his favor is like dew on the grass. and a contentious wife is like a constant dripping. but a prudent wife is from the Lord . and the idle person will go hungry. the one who despises his ways will die. and the Lord will repay him for his good deed. but do not set your heart on causing his death. but if you deliver him from it once, you will have to do it again. that you may become wise by the end of your life. but it is the counsel of the Lord which will stand. and a poor person is better than a liar. and one who does so will live satisfied; he will not be afflicted by calamity. and he will not even bring it back to his mouth! correct a discerning person, and as a result he will understand knowledge. is a son who brings shame and disgrace. you will stray from the words of knowledge. and the mouth of the wicked devours iniquity.
It is dangerous to have zeal without knowledge,
A person"s folly subverts his way,
Wealth adds many friends,
A false witness will not go unpunished,
Many people entreat the favor of a generous person,
All the relatives of a poor person hate him; how much more do his friends avoid him – and floggings for the backs of fools.
The one who acquires wisdom loves himself;
A false witness will not go unpunished,
Luxury is not appropriate for a fool;
A person"s wisdom makes him slow to anger,
A king"s wrath is like the roar of a lion,
A foolish child is the ruin of his father,
A house and wealth are inherited from parents,
Laziness brings on a deep sleep,
The one who obeys commandments guards his life;
The one who is gracious to the poor lends to the Lord ,
Discipline your child, for there is hope,
A person with great anger bears the penalty,
Listen to advice and receive discipline,
There are many plans in a person"s mind,
What is desirable for a person is to show loyal love,
Fearing the Lord leads to life,
The sluggard plunges his hand in the dish,
Flog a scorner, and as a result the simpleton will learn prudence;
The one who robs his father and chases away his mother
If you stop listening to instruction, my child,
A crooked witness scorns justice,
Judgments are prepared for scorners,

20.verse_text: Wine is a mocker and strong drink is a brawler; whoever goes astray by them is not wise. whoever provokes him sins against himself. but every fool quarrels. so at harvest time he looks for the crop but has nothing. but an understanding person draws it out. but a faithful person – who can find? blessed are his children after him. separates out all evil with his eyes. I am pure from my sin'? the Lord abhors both of them. whether his activity is pure and whether it is right. the Lord has made them both. open your eyes so that you might be satisfied with food. but when he goes on his way, he boasts. but words of knowledge are like a precious jewel. and when he gives surety for strangers, hold him in pledge. but afterward his mouth will be filled with gravel. so make war with guidance. therefore do not associate with someone who is always opening his mouth. his lamp will be extinguished in the blackest darkness. will not be blessed in the end. Wait for the Lord, so that he may vindicate you. and dishonest scales are wicked. so how can anyone understand his own way? and only afterward to consider what he has vowed. he turns the threshing wheel over them. searching all his innermost parts. and his throne is upheld by loyal love. and the splendor of old men is gray hair. and floggings cleanse the innermost being.
The king"s terrifying anger is like the roar of a lion;
It is an honor for a person to cease from strife,
The sluggard will not plow during the planting season,
Counsel in a person"s heart is like deep water,
Many people profess their loyalty,
The righteous person behaves in integrity;
A king sitting on the throne to judge
Who can say, 'I have kept my heart clean;
Diverse weights and diverse measures –
Even a young man is known by his actions,
The ear that hears and the eye that sees –
Do not love sleep, lest you become impoverished;
'It"s worthless! It"s worthless!' says the buyer,
There is gold, and an abundance of rubies,
Take a man"s garment when he has given security for a stranger,
Bread gained by deceit tastes sweet to a person,
Plans are established by counsel,
The one who goes about gossiping reveals secrets;
The one who curses his father and his mother,
An inheritance gained easily in the beginning
Do not say, 'I will pay back evil!'
The Lord abhors differing weights,
The steps of a person are ordained by the Lord –
It is a snare for a person to rashly cry, 'Holy!'
A wise king separates out the wicked;
The human spirit is like the lamp of the Lord,
Loyal love and truth preserve a king,
The glory of young men is their strength,
Beatings and wounds cleanse away evil,

21.verse_text: The king"s heart is in the hand of the Lord like channels of water; he turns it wherever he wants.

All of a person"s ways seem right in his own opinion, but the Lord evaluates the motives. is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice. the agricultural product of the wicked is sin. but everyone who is hasty comes only to poverty. they seek death. because they refuse to do what is right. but as for the pure, his way is upright. than in a house in company with a quarrelsome wife. his neighbor is shown no favor in his eyes. when a wise person is instructed, he gains knowledge. he overthrows the wicked to their ruin. he too will cry out and will not be answered. and a bribe given secretly subdues strong wrath. and terror to those who do evil. will end up in the company of the departed. whoever loves wine and anointing oil will not be rich. and the faithless are taken in the place of the upright. than with a quarrelsome and easily-provoked woman. but a foolish person devours all he has. finds life, bounty, and honor. and bring down the stronghold in which they trust. keeps his life from troubles. acts with overbearing pride. for his hands refuse to work. but the righteous gives and does not hold back. how much more when he brings it with evil intent! but the one who reports accurately speaks forever. but as for the upright, he discerns his ways. and there is no counsel against the Lord . but the victory is from the Lord .
To do righteousness and justice
Haughty eyes and a proud heart –
The plans of the diligent lead only to plenty,
Making a fortune by a lying tongue is like a vapor driven back and forth;
The violence done by the wicked will drag them away
The way of the guilty person is devious,
It is better to live on a corner of the housetop
The appetite of the wicked desires evil;
When a scorner is punished, the naive becomes wise;
The Righteous One considers the house of the wicked;
The one who shuts his ears to the cry of the poor,
A gift given in secret subdues anger,
Doing justice brings joy to the righteous
The one who wanders from the way of wisdom
The one who loves pleasure will be a poor person;
The wicked become a ransom for the righteous,
It is better to live in a desert land
There is desirable treasure and olive oil in the dwelling of the wise,
The one who pursues righteousness and love
The wise person can scale the city of the mighty
The one who guards his mouth and his tongue
A proud and arrogant person, whose name is 'Scoffer,'
What the sluggard desires will kill him,
All day long he craves greedily,
The wicked person"s sacrifice is an abomination;
A lying witness will perish,
A wicked person shows boldness with his face,
There is no wisdom and there is no understanding,
A horse is prepared for the day of battle,

22.verse_text: A good name is to be chosen rather than great wealth, good favor more than silver or gold. the Lord is the creator of them both. but the naive keep right on going and suffer for it. and when he is old he will not turn from it. and the borrower is servant to the lender. and the rod of his fury will end. for he gives some of his food to the poor. strife and insults will cease. and whose speech is gracious – the king will be his friend. but he overthrows the words of the faithless person. I will be killed in the middle of the streets!' the one against whom the Lord is angry will fall into it. but the rod of discipline will drive it far from him. and the one who gives to the rich – both end up only in poverty. and apply your heart to my instruction. and they are ready on your lips. I am making them known to you today – even you. sayings of counsel and knowledge, so that you may give accurate answers to those who sent you? and do not crush the needy in court, and will rob those who are robbing them. and entangle yourself in a snare. your bed will be taken right out from under you! which was put in place by your ancestors. he will not take his position before obscure people.
The rich and the poor meet together;
A shrewd person sees danger and hides himself,

The reward for humility and fearing the Lord is riches and honor and life. but the one who guards himself keeps far from them. and do not associate with a wrathful person, or who puts up security for debts. He will take his position before kings;
Thorns and snares are in the path of the perverse,
Train a child in the way that he should go,
The rich rule over the poor,
The one who sows iniquity will reap trouble,
A generous person will be blessed,
Drive out the scorner and contention will leave;
The one who loves a pure heart
The eyes of the Lord guard knowledge,
The sluggard says, 'There is a lion outside!
The mouth of an adulteress is like a deep pit;
Folly is bound up in the heart of a child,
The one who oppresses the poor to increase his own gain
Incline your ear and listen to the words of the wise,
For it is pleasing if you keep these sayings within you,
So that your confidence may be in the Lord,
Have I not written thirty sayings for you,
to show you true and reliable words,
Do not exploit a poor person because he is poor
for the Lord will plead their case
Do not make friends with an angry person,
lest you learn his ways
Do not be one who strikes hands in pledge
If you do not have enough to pay,
Do not move an ancient boundary stone
Do you see a person skilled in his work?

23.verse_text: When you sit down to eat with a ruler, consider carefully what is before you, if you possess a large appetite. for that food is deceptive. be wise enough to restrain yourself. and fly off into the sky like an eagle! and will have wasted your pleasant words. for he will despise the wisdom of your words. or take over the fields of the fatherless, he will plead their case against you. you will deliver him from death. when your lips speak what is right. but rather be zealous in fearing the Lord all the time. and your hope will not be cut off. among those who eat too much meat, and drowsiness clothes them with rags. whoever fathers a wise child will have joy in him. may she who bore you rejoice. a harlot is like a narrow well. and increases the unfaithful among men. Who has wounds without cause? Who has dullness of the eyes? those who go looking for mixed wine. when it sparkles in the cup, when it goes down smoothly. and like one who lies down on the top of the rigging. They beat me, but I did not know it! When will I awake? I will look for another drink.'
and put a knife to your throat
Do not crave that ruler"s delicacies,
Do not wear yourself out to become rich;

When you gaze upon riches, they are gone, for they surely make wings for themselves, do not crave his delicacies; 'Eat and drink,' he says to you, but his heart is not with you; and your ears to the words of knowledge. even if you strike him with the rod, he will not die. then my heart also will be glad; and guide your heart on the right way. and do not despise your mother when she is old. wisdom, and discipline, and understanding. and let your eyes observe my ways; Who has contentions? Who has complaints? and stings like a viper. and your mind will speak perverse things.
Do not eat the food of a stingy person,
for he is like someone calculating the cost in his mind.
you will vomit up the little bit you have eaten,
Do not speak in the ears of a fool,
Do not move an ancient boundary stone,
for their Protector is strong;
Apply your heart to instruction
Do not withhold discipline from a child;
If you strike him with the rod,
My child, if your heart is wise,
my soul will rejoice
Do not let your heart envy sinners,
For surely there is a future,
Listen, my child, and be wise,
Do not spend time among drunkards,
because drunkards and gluttons become impoverished,
Listen to your father who begot you,
Acquire truth and do not sell it –
The father of a righteous person will rejoice greatly;
May your father and your mother have joy;
Give me your heart, my son,
for a prostitute is like a deep pit;
Indeed, she lies in wait like a robber,
Who has woe? Who has sorrow?
Those who linger over wine,
Do not look on the wine when it is red,
Afterward it bites like a snake,
Your eyes will see strange things,
And you will be like one who lies down in the midst of the sea,
You will say, 'They have struck me, but I am not harmed!

24.verse_text: Do not envy evil people, do not desire to be with them; and their lips speak harm. and with numerous advisers there is victory. in court he does not open his mouth. will be called a scheming person. and the scorner is an abomination to people. your strength is small! and hold back those slipping to the slaughter. does not the one who evaluates hearts consider? Will he not repay each person according to his deeds? if you find it, you will have a future, do not assault his home. but the wicked will be brought down by calamity. and turn his wrath away from him. and the lamp of the wicked will be extinguished. and do not associate with rebels, and who knows the ruinous judgment both the Lord and the king can bring? To show partiality in judgment is terrible: peoples will curse him, and nations will denounce him. and a pleasing blessing will come on them. afterward build your house. and do not deceive with your words. I will pay him back according to what he has done.' by the vineyard of one who lacks wisdom. the ground was covered with weeds, I received instruction from what I saw: and your need like an armed robber.'
for their hearts contemplate violence,

By wisdom a house is built, and through understanding it is established; with all kinds of precious and pleasing treasures. and a man of knowledge makes his strength stronger; Does not the one who guards your life know? and honey from the honeycomb is sweet to your taste. and your hope will not be cut off. and when he stumbles do not let your heart rejoice, or be envious of wicked people, is the one who gives an honest answer. and its stone wall was broken down. a little folding of the hands to relax,
by knowledge its rooms are filled
A wise warrior is strong,
for with guidance you wage your war,
Wisdom is unattainable for a fool;
The one who plans to do evil
A foolish scheme is sin,
If you faint in the day of trouble,
Deliver those being taken away to death,
If you say, 'But we did not know about this,'
Eat honey, my child, for it is good,
Likewise, know that wisdom is sweet to your soul;
Do not lie in wait like the wicked against the place where the righteous live;
Although a righteous person may fall seven times, he gets up again,
Do not rejoice when your enemy falls,
lest the Lord see it, and be displeased,
Do not fret because of evil people
for the evil person has no future,
Fear the Lord , my child, as well as the king,
for suddenly their destruction will overtake them,
These sayings also are from the wise:
The one who says to the guilty, 'You are innocent,'
But there will be delight for those who convict the guilty,
Like a kiss on the lips
Establish your work outside and get your fields ready;
Do not be a witness against your neighbor without cause,
Do not say, 'I will do to him just as he has done to me;
I passed by the field of a sluggard,
I saw that thorns had grown up all over it,
When I saw this, I gave careful consideration to it;
'A little sleep, a little slumber,
and your poverty will come like a bandit,

25.verse_text: These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of King Hezekiah of Judah copied: so the hearts of kings are unsearchable. and material for the silversmith will emerge; and his throne will be established in righteousness. than to put you lower before a prince, whom your eyes have seen. or what will you do afterward do not reveal the secret of another person, and your infamy will never go away. so is a word skillfully spoken. so is a wise reprover to the ear of the one who listens. for he refreshes the heart of his masters. so is the one who boasts of a gift not given. and a soft tongue can break a bone. lest you become stuffed with it and vomit it up. lest he become weary of you and hate you. so is the one who testifies against his neighbor as a false witness. so is confidence in an unfaithful person at the time of trouble. or like vinegar poured on soda, so is one who sings songs to a heavy heart. and the Lord will reward you. and a gossiping tongue brings forth an angry look. than in a house in company with a quarrelsome wife. so is good news from a distant land. so is a righteous person who gives way before the wicked. nor is it honorable for people to seek their own glory. so is a person who cannot control his temper.

It is the glory of God to conceal a matter, and it is the glory of a king to search out a matter. and do not stand in the place of great men; when your neighbor puts you to shame? so is a faithful messenger to those who send him, and if he is thirsty, give him water to drink,
As the heaven is high and the earth is deep
Remove the dross from the silver,
remove the wicked from before the king,
Do not honor yourself before the king,
for it is better for him to say to you, 'Come up here,'
Do not go out hastily to litigation,
When you argue a case with your neighbor,
lest the one who hears it put you to shame
Like apples of gold in settings of silver,
Like an earring of gold and an ornament of fine gold,
Like the cold of snow in the time of harvest,
Like cloudy skies and wind that produce no rain,
Through patience a ruler can be persuaded,
When you find honey, eat only what is sufficient for you,
Don"t set foot too frequently in your neighbor"s house,
Like a club or a sword or a sharp arrow,
Like a bad tooth or a foot out of joint,
Like one who takes off a garment on a cold day,
If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat,
for you will heap coals of fire on his head,
The north wind brings forth rain,
It is better to live on a corner of the housetop
Like cold water to a weary person,
Like a muddied spring and a polluted well,
It is not good to eat too much honey,
Like a city that is broken down and without a wall,

26.verse_text: Like snow in summer or rain in harvest, so honor is not fitting for a fool. so a curse without cause does not come to rest. and a rod for the backs of fools! lest you yourself also be like him. lest he be wise in his own estimation. so is sending a message by the hand of a fool. so is a proverb in the mouth of fools. so is a proverb in the mouth of a fool. so is the one who hires a fool or hires any passer-by. so a fool repeats his folly. There is more hope for a fool than for him. A lion in the streets!' so a sluggard turns on his bed. he is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth. than seven people who respond with good sense. so is the person passing by who becomes furious over a quarrel not his own. firebrands and deadly arrows, and says, 'Was I not only joking?' and where there is no gossip, contention ceases. so is a contentious person to kindle strife. they go down into a person"s innermost being. are fervent lips with an evil heart. but he stores up deceit within him. for there are seven abominations within him. his evil will be uncovered in the assembly. and a flattering mouth works ruin.
Like a fluttering bird or like a flying swallow,
A whip for the horse and a bridle for the donkey,
Do not answer a fool according to his folly,
Answer a fool according to his folly,
Like cutting off the feet or drinking violence,
Like legs that hang limp from the lame,
Like tying a stone in a sling, so is giving honor to a fool. the one who rolls a stone – it will come back on him.
Like a thorn that goes into the hand of a drunkard,
Like an archer who wounds at random,
Like a dog that returns to its vomit,
Do you see a man wise in his own eyes?
The sluggard says, 'There is a lion in the road!
Like a door that turns on its hinges,
The sluggard plunges his hand in the dish;
The sluggard is wiser in his own estimation
Like one who grabs a wild dog by the ears,
Like a madman who shoots
so is a person who deceives his neighbor,
Where there is no wood, a fire goes out,
Like charcoal is to burning coals, and wood to fire,
The words of a gossip are like delicious morsels;
Like a coating of glaze over earthenware
The one who hates others disguises it with his lips,
When he speaks graciously, do not believe him,
Though his hatred may be concealed by deceit,
The one who digs a pit will fall into it;
A lying tongue hates those crushed by it,

27.verse_text: Do not boast about tomorrow; for you do not know what a day may bring forth. someone else, and not your own lips. but vexation by a fool is more burdensome than the two of them. but who can stand before jealousy? than hidden love. but the kisses of an enemy are excessive. but to the hungry mouth every bitter thing is sweet. so is a person who wanders from his home. likewise the sweetness of one"s friend from sincere counsel. a neighbor nearby is better than a brother far away. so that I may answer anyone who taunts me. but the naive keep right on going and suffer for it. and when he gives surety for a stranger, hold him in pledge. it will be counted as a curse to him. and a contentious wife are alike. or grasps oil with his right hand. so a person sharpens his friend. and whoever takes care of his master will be honored. so a person"s heart reflects the person. so the eyes of a person are never satisfied. so a person is proved by the praise he receives. among the grain with the pestle, his foolishness would not depart from him. give careful attention to your herds, nor does a crown last from generation to generation. and the goats will be for the price of a field. and for the sustenance of your servant girls.
Let another praise you, and not your own mouth;
A stone is heavy and sand is weighty,
Wrath is cruel and anger is overwhelming,
Better is open rebuke
Faithful are the wounds of a friend,
The one whose appetite is satisfied loathes honey,
Like a bird that wanders from its nest,
Ointment and incense make the heart rejoice,
Do not forsake your friend and your father"s friend, and do not enter your brother"s house in the day of your disaster; and the grass from the hills is gathered in, for the food of your household,
Be wise, my son, and make my heart glad,
A shrewd person sees danger and hides himself,
Take a man"s garment when he has given security for a stranger,
If someone blesses his neighbor with a loud voice early in the morning,
A continual dripping on a rainy day
Whoever hides her hides the wind
As iron sharpens iron,
The one who tends a fig tree will eat its fruit,
As in water the face is reflected as a face,
As Death and Destruction are never satisfied,
As the crucible is for silver and the furnace is for gold,
If you should pound the fool in the mortar
Pay careful attention to the condition of your flocks,
for riches do not last forever,
When the hay is removed and new grass appears,
the lambs will be for your clothing,
And there will be enough goat"s milk for your food,

28.verse_text: The wicked person flees when there is no one pursuing, but the righteous person is as confident as a lion. but by someone who is discerning and knowledgeable order is maintained. is like a driving rain without food. but those who keep the law contend with them. but those who seek the Lord understand it all. than one who is perverse in his ways even though he is rich. but a companion of gluttons brings shame to his parents. gathers it for someone who is gracious to the needy. even his prayer is an abomination. will himself fall into his own pit, but the blameless will inherit what is good. but a discerning poor person can evaluate him properly. but when the wicked rise to power, people are sought out. but whoever confesses them and forsakes them will find mercy. but whoever hardens his heart will fall into evil. so is a wicked ruler over a poor people. but the one who hates unjust gain will prolong his days. but whoever is perverse in his ways will fall at once. but whoever chases daydreams will have his fill of poverty. but the one who hastens to gain riches will not go unpunished. for a person will transgress over the smallest piece of bread. and does not know that poverty will overtake him. than the one who flatters with the tongue. is a companion to the one who destroys. but the one who trusts in the Lord will prosper. but the one who walks in wisdom will escape. but whoever shuts his eyes to them will receive many curses. but when they perish, the righteous increase.
When a country is rebellious it has many princes,
A poor person who oppresses the weak
Those who forsake the law praise the wicked,
Evil people do not understand justice,
A poor person who walks in his integrity is better
The one who keeps the law is a discerning child,
The one who increases his wealth by increasing interest
The one who turns away his ear from hearing the law,
The one who leads the upright astray in an evil way
A rich person is wise in his own eyes,
When the righteous rejoice, great is the glory,
The one who covers his transgressions will not prosper,
Blessed is the one who is always cautious,
Like a roaring lion or a roving bear,
The prince who is a great oppressor lacks wisdom,
The one who is tormented by the murder of another will flee to the pit; let no one support him.
The one who walks blamelessly will be delivered,
The one who works his land will be satisfied with food,
A faithful person will have an abundance of blessings,
To show partiality is terrible,
The stingy person hastens after riches
The one who reproves another will in the end find more favor
The one who robs his father and mother and says, 'There is no transgression,'
The greedy person stirs up dissension,
The one who trusts in his own heart is a fool,
The one who gives to the poor will not lack,
When the wicked gain control, people hide themselves,

29.verse_text: The one who stiffens his neck after numerous rebukes will suddenly be destroyed without remedy. when the wicked rule, the people groan. but whoever associates with prostitutes wastes his wealth. but one who exacts tribute tears it down. spreads a net for his steps. but a righteous person can sing and rejoice. the wicked does not understand such knowledge. there is no peace whether he is angry or laughs. as for the upright, they seek his life. but a wise person keeps it back. all his ministers will be wicked. the Lord gives light to the eyes of them both. his throne will be established forever. but a child who is unrestrained brings shame to his mother. but the righteous will see their downfall. he will bring you happiness. but the one who keeps the law, blessed is he! for although he understands, there is no answer. There is more hope for a fool than for him. he will be a weakling in the end. and a wrathful person is abounding in transgression. but one who has a lowly spirit will gain honor. he hears the oath to testify, but does not talk. but whoever trusts in the Lord will be set on high. but it is from the Lord that one receives justice. and the one who lives an upright life is an abomination to the wicked.
When the righteous become numerous, the people rejoice;
The man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father,
A king brings stability to a land by justice,
The one who flatters his neighbor
In the transgression of an evil person there is a snare,
The righteous person cares for the legal rights of the poor;
Scornful people inflame a city, but those who are wise turn away wrath.
If a wise person goes to court with a foolish person,
Bloodthirsty people hate someone with integrity;
A fool lets fly with all his temper,
If a ruler listens to lies,
The poor person and the oppressor have this in common:
If a king judges the poor in truth,
A rod and reproof impart wisdom,
When the wicked increase, transgression increases,
Discipline your child, and he will give you rest;
When there is no prophetic vision the people cast off restraint,
A servant cannot be corrected by words,
Do you see someone who is hasty in his words?
If someone pampers his servant from youth,
An angry person stirs up dissension,
A person"s pride will bring him low,
Whoever shares with a thief is his own enemy;
The fear of people becomes a snare,
Many people seek the face of a ruler,
An unjust person is an abomination to the righteous,

30.verse_text: The words of Agur, the son of Jakeh; an oracle: This man says to Ithiel, to Ithiel and to Ukal: and I do not have human understanding; nor do I have knowledge of the Holy One. Who has gathered up the winds in his fists? Who has bound up the waters in his cloak? Who has established all the ends of the earth? What is his name, and what is his son"s name? – if you know! he is like a shield for those who take refuge in him. lest he reprove you, and prove you to be a liar. feed me with my allotted portion of bread, and demean the name of my God. lest he curse you, and you are found guilty. and do not bless their mothers. and yet are not washed from their filthiness. and whose eyelids are lifted up disdainfully. and whose molars are like knives to devour the poor from the earth 'Give! Give!' four that never say, 'Enough' – and fire that never says, 'Enough!' and despises obeying a mother – and the young vultures will eat it. and the way of a man with a woman. she eats and wipes her mouth and says, 'I have not done wrong.' under a fool who is stuffed with food, and under a female servant who dispossesses her mistress. but they are exceedingly wise: but they prepare their food in the summer; but they all go forward by ranks; but it gets into the palaces of the king. four things that move about magnificently: and a king with his army around him. put your hand over your mouth! so stirring up anger produces strife.
Surely I am more brutish than any other human being,
I have not learned wisdom,
Who has ascended into heaven, and then descended?
Every word of God is purified;
Do not add to his words,

Two things I ask from you; do not refuse me before I die: do not give me poverty or riches, and say, 'Who is the Lord ?' Or lest I become poor and steal and the needy from among the human race. There are three things that are never satisfied, land that is not satisfied with water, the ravens of the valley will peck it out four that I do not understand: the way of a snake on a rock, the way of a ship in the sea, and under four things it cannot bear up: but they make their homes in the crags; who does not retreat from anything; or if you have planned evil, and as punching the nose produces blood,
Remove falsehood and lies far from me;
lest I become satisfied and act deceptively
Do not slander a servant to his master,
There is a generation who curse their fathers
There is a generation who are pure in their own eyes
There is a generation whose eyes are so lofty,
There is a generation whose teeth are like swords
The leech has two daughters:
the grave, the barren womb,
The eye that mocks at a father
There are three things that are too wonderful for me,
the way of an eagle in the sky,
This is the way of an adulterous woman:
Under three things the earth trembles,
under a servant who becomes king,
under an unloved woman who is married,
There are four things on earth that are small,
ants are creatures with little strength,
rock badgers are creatures with little power,
locusts have no king,
a lizard you can catch with the hand,
There are three things that are magnificent in their step,
a lion, mightiest of the beasts,
a strutting rooster, a male goat,
If you have done foolishly by exalting yourself
For as the churning of milk produces butter

31.verse_text: The words of King Lemuel, an oracle that his mother taught him: O son of my vows, nor your ways to that which ruins kings. it is not for kings to drink wine, or for rulers to crave strong drink, and remove from all the poor their legal rights. and wine to those who are bitterly distressed; for the legal rights of all the dying. and plead the cause of the poor and needy. For her value is far more than rubies. and he has no lack of gain. and she is pleased to work with her hands. and provides food for her household and a portion to her female servants. from her own income she plants a vineyard. and she strengthens her arms. and her lamp does not go out in the night. for all of her household are clothed with scarlet. her clothing is fine linen and purple. when he sits with the elders of the land. and supplies the merchants with sashes. and she can laugh at the time to come. and loving instruction is on her tongue. and does not eat the bread of idleness. her husband also praises her: but a woman who fears the Lord will be praised. and let her works praise her in the city gates.
O my son, O son of my womb,
Do not give your strength to women,
It is not for kings, O Lemuel,
lest they drink and forget what is decreed,
Give strong drink to the one who is perishing,

let them drink and forget their poverty, and remember their misery no more. all the days of her life. she brings her food from afar. and her hands grasp the spindle. and reaches out her hand to the needy. but you surpass them all!'
Open your mouth on behalf of those unable to speak,
Open your mouth, judge in righteousness,
Who can find a wife of noble character?
The heart of her husband has confidence in her,
She brings him good and not evil
She obtains wool and flax,
She is like the merchant ships;
She also gets up while it is still night,
She considers a field and buys it;
She begins her work vigorously,
She knows that her merchandise is good,
Her hands take hold of the distaff,
She extends her hand to the poor,
She is not afraid of the snow for her household,
She makes for herself coverlets;
Her husband is well-known in the city gate
She makes linen garments and sells them,
She is clothed with strength and honor,
She opens her mouth with wisdom,
She watches over the ways of her household,
Her children rise up and call her blessed,
'Many daughters have done valiantly,
Charm is deceitful and beauty is fleeting,
Give her credit for what she has accomplished,
